org.lightningj.paywall.btcpayserver

Class BTCPayServerHTTPSender

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.lightningj.paywall.btcpayserver.BTCPayServerHTTPSender

  • public class BTCPayServerHTTPSender
extends java.lang.Object
    Class in charge of the http transport parts of sending JSON data to BTC Pay Server. Created by philip on 2018-10-15.

    • Constructor Detail

      • BTCPayServerHTTPSender

        public BTCPayServerHTTPSender(java.lang.String baseURL,
                              AsymmetricKeyManager keyManager)
        Constructor of BTCPayServerHTTPSender when using default SSL Context.
        Parameters:
        baseURL - the baseURL for the REST endpoint of BTC Pay Server.
        keyManager - the current key manager holding the signing keys.

      • BTCPayServerHTTPSender

        public BTCPayServerHTTPSender(java.lang.String baseURL,
                              AsymmetricKeyManager keyManager,
                              javax.net.ssl.SSLContext sslContext)
        Constructor of BTCPayServerHTTPSender when using a custom SSL Context.
        Parameters:
        baseURL - the baseURL for the REST endpoint of BTC Pay Server.
        keyManager - the current key manager holding the signing keys.
        sslContext - the custom SSL Context in order to connect to BTC Pay Server.

    • Method Detail

      • send

        public byte[] send(BTCPayServerHTTPSender.METHOD method,
                   java.lang.String endpoint,
                   boolean sign)
            throws InternalErrorException,
                   java.io.IOException
        Method to send data to given REST endpoint of BTC Pay Server.
        Parameters:
        method - the HTTP method to use.
        endpoint - the REST endpoint, i.e '/invoices', starting with "/"
        sign - if the request should contain a x-signature header.
        Returns:
        the resulting json data in the response.
        Throws:
        InternalErrorException - if internal error occurred setting up communication or BTC Pay Server signaled error.
        java.io.IOException - if communication problems occurred.

      • send

        public byte[] send(BTCPayServerHTTPSender.METHOD method,
                   java.lang.String endpoint,
                   byte[] requestJson,
                   boolean sign)
            throws InternalErrorException,
                   java.io.IOException
        Method to send data to given REST endpoint of BTC Pay Server.
        Parameters:
        method - the HTTP method to use.
        endpoint - the REST endpoint, i.e '/invoices', starting with "/"
        requestJson - The JSON data to send, null to not perform any output body. (GET requests)
        sign - if the request should contain a x-signature header.
        Returns:
        the resulting json data in the response.
        Throws:
        InternalErrorException - if internal error occurred setting up communication or BTC Pay Server signaled error.
        java.io.IOException - if communication problems occurred.

        endpoint - the REST endpoint, i.e '/invoices', starting with "/"
        requestJson - The JSON data to send, null to not perform any output body. (GET requests)
        sign - if the request should contain a x-signature header.
        Returns:
        the resulting json data in the response.
        Throws:
        InternalErrorException - if internal error occurred setting up communication or BTC Pay Server signaled error.

      • send

        public byte[] send(BTCPayServerHTTPSender.METHOD method,
                   java.lang.String endpoint,
                   boolean sign,
                   java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> queryParams)
            throws InternalErrorException,
                   java.io.IOException
        Method to send data to given REST endpoint of BTC Pay Server.
        Parameters:
        method - the HTTP method to use.
        endpoint - the REST endpoint, i.e '/invoices', starting with "/"
        sign - if the request should contain a x-signature header.
        queryParams - a map of query parameters appended to the URI string.
        Returns:
        the resulting json data in the response.
        Throws:
        InternalErrorException - if internal error occurred setting up communication or BTC Pay Server signaled error.
        java.io.IOException - if communication problems occurred.

            throws InternalErrorException,
                   java.io.IOException
        Method to send data to given REST endpoint of BTC Pay Server.
        Parameters:
        method - the HTTP method to use.
        endpoint - the REST endpoint, i.e '/invoices', starting with "/"
        requestJson - The JSON data to send, null to not perform any output body. (GET requests)
        sign - if the request should contain a x-signature header.
        queryParams - a map of query parameters appended to the URI string.
        Returns:
        the resulting json data in the response.
        Throws:
        InternalErrorException - if internal error occurred setting up communication or BTC Pay Server signaled error.
        java.io.IOException - if communication problems occurred.
